nodes.text: The Jedd system was located in Wild Space. The sixth orbital position in the system was occupied by the planet Jedd Six. During the last years of the Galactic Republic, the Human Lexi Fernandin became the first individual to scout the planet.

The Jedd system was first mentioned in "Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star, How I Wonder Where We Are," a 1990 roleplaying game source article written by Glen Allison as a supplement for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game and published in Voyages SF 13. The article placed it, as well as the Begali, Columus, Grehollo, Jerijador, Kaelta, Nosken, and Tsukkia systems, in the Grehollo sector.

Since that article was released outside of the Lucas Licensing process, its canonicity within the Star Wars Legends continuity was never confirmed. The StarWars.com Online Companion to the 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas has since instead placed the Grehollo, Jerijador, Kaelta, Nosken, and Tsukkia systems in other sectors. Furthermore, since the Online Companion has also placed the Begali, Columus, and Jedd systems each in a different galactic region—with the Jedd system being situated in grid square I-14—this article assumes the Voyages SF 13 placement is no longer applicable to any of the systems listed here.
